quadratics-graph.text: Graph quadratic functions and show intercepts, maxima, and minima.

quadratics-growth.text: Identify quadratic sequences of numbers by the fact that the difference between terms always changes by the same amount.

quadratic-situations.text: Identify situations than can be modeled by a quadratic relationship.

quadratics-forms.text: Express quadratic equations in standard, factored, and vertex forms and convert between these forms.

exponentials-graph.text: Graph exponential functions, showing intercepts and asymptotes.

exponentials-growth.text: Identify exponential sequences of numbers by the fact that the difference between terms always changes by a constant factor.

exponential-situations.text: Identify situations than can be modeled by an exponential relationship.

logarithms-graph.text: Graph logarithmic functions, showing intercepts and asymptotes.

logarithms-growth.text: Identify logarithmic sequences of numbers by the fact that the _index_ of a term must change by constant factor in order for the term to grow linearly.

logarithms-situations.text: Identify situations than can be modeled by a logarithmic relationship.

logarithms-exponents.text: Understand the inverse relationship between exponents and logarithms and use this relationship to solve problems involving logarithms and exponents.

periodic-unit-circle.text: Explain the relationship between the angle Î¸ and the (x,y) values of a point rotating around a unit circle

periodic-growth.text: Identify periodic sequences of numbers by the fact that they rise and fall smoothly in consistent patterns over consistent intervals.

periodic-graph.text: Graph sin and cos functions, showing horizontal and vertical shifts, midlines, peaks, troughs, amplitude and frequency.

periodic-situations.text: Identify situations than can be modeled by a periodic relationship.
